mdx.rawBody:
---
status: draft
shortDescription: "If a variable is at least as big (bit-width) as a value, then no cast is needed to a assign the value to the variable"
shortCorrection: "A variable being at least as big (bit-width) as a value may not be sufficient to avoid a cast when assigning the value to the variable"
concepts:
  - Variable
  - Value
  - Number
  - Type
related:
# - id: LiteralNoExpression
#   relation: Special case
inOtherPl:
# - pl: JavaScript
#   id: NoCastIfSameSize
# - pl: Python
#   id: NoCastIfSameSize
spec:
  - id: jls21
    sections: ["5.1"]
plVersion:
# from: jls8
# to: jls14
expressibleInNms:
  - id: ExpressionAsTree
    how: expression involving assignment of smaller bit-width value to larger bit-width variable
---

One can assign a value to a variable without needing any explicit cast if the variable's type's size is at least as big (in terms of the number of bits) as the value's type's size (e.g., a `float` value can be assigned to an `int` variable without a cast).

frontmatter.shortDescription: If a variable is at least as big (bit-width) as a value, then no cast is needed to a assign the value to the variable
frontmatter.shortCorrection: A variable being at least as big (bit-width) as a value may not be sufficient to avoid a cast when assigning the value to the variable
